title: City watchdog failed to visit ailing peer-to-peer firm Lendy for 14 months as it neared collapse
text:
The City watchdog failed to visit the premises of troubled peer-to-peer provider Lendy for more than a year in the lead up to its collapse, despite knowing of issues at the firm.

Lendy became the latest high-profile peer-to-peer platform to fail when it closed its doors in May 2019, leaving £152m of investors’ cash on the line.

The firm had offered customers returns of up to 12pc on property investment projects but suffered widespread defaults when the borrowers using the platform failed to repay their loans.
